name: Bombieri–Lang conjecture
rephrased: Faltings's theorem proves that curves of general type have finitely many rational points. The Bombieri–Lang conjecture extends this to higher-dimensional varieties, stating that any positive-dimensional projective variety of general type defined over a number field should have rational points that are not Zariski-dense (i.e., they lie on a proper subvariety).
implication_form: If X is a positive-dimensional projective variety defined over a number field K and X is of general type, then the set of K-rational points on X is not Zariski-dense.
posed_by: Enrico Bombieri and David W. Lang
